newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - November 6.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - November 6.

text.p: Following are the highlights of stories reported in the Irish press on Wednesday.
- Exchequer overspending has cut the Irish government's tax bonanza by half and will severely limit its scope scope for tax relief in the Budget.
- The Irish government is applying to the EU Commisssion for funding of up to 25 million Irish pounds for a new conference centre at Dublin's RDS arena.
- A fleeing joyrider armed with a syringe caused a six-car pile-up on Dublin streets after a robbery spree on Tuesday.
- Irish job creation agency IDA is to announce up 2,000 hi-tech jobs over the next few weeks, industry sources said.

- The Irish minister for Finance Ruairi Quinn gave strong indications on Tuesday that he plans to bring proposals before Cabinet with a view to a possible sale of TSB Bank and recapitalisation of State-owned banks ICC and ACC
